header.name: chaos/preprocessor/generics/is_elemental.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a macro that determines if the type of a is elemental.

macro.abstract: The macro determines if the type represented by its argument is elemental.
macro.para: If the type represented by type is elemental, this macro expands to 1. Otherwise, it expands to 0.

The type of a is elemental if the elements contained therein are not variadic (i.e. the contained elements are all the same arity). Consequently, in C (prior to C99) and C++ this macro always expands to 1 because only unary elements are supported.
